definition: to recollect
to sculpt/to carve/musical instrument (old)
to chase after/to seek/to do one's utmost to seek or procure sth/to recall

to read/to study (a subject)/to attend (a school)/to read aloud/to give (sb) a tongue-lashing (CL:頓|顿[dun4])/to miss (sb)/idea/remembrance/twenty (banker's anti-fraud numeral corresponding to 廿[nian4])
variant of 念[nian4], to read aloud

sentences.english: Back to thinking about the battlefield, there is a simile I can give you.
sentences.chinese: 追念战争，我能赐与你们一个明喻的讲法。

sentences.english: Funerals should not only serve to memorialize the dead, but also to give hope to those they`ve left behind.
sentences.chinese: 葬礼不该仅仅是为了追念逝者，还要给予生者希望。

sentences.english: Pull remember not to put, you were injured or who.
sentences.chinese: 拽着追念不放，伤的是你还是谁。

sentences.english: For enquire, I pray thee, of the former age, and prepare thyself to the search of their fathers
sentences.chinese: 请你考问前代，追念他们的列祖所查究的。

sentences.english: Certainly, I confess that my reminiscences to mother are in pieces throughout.
sentences.chinese: 当然，我承认，我对母亲的追念充满残缺。

sentences.english: The event was later memorialized in a Verdi opera.
sentences.chinese: 之后，韦瓦第在他的歌剧中追念此一事件。

sentences.english: He lives in the past now,bethinking himself of happier days.
sentences.chinese: 他现在追念过去，缅怀往昔更美好的日子。

definition: to recall/to bring to mind/to reminisce
memorial/recollection (of the deceased)
to commemorate/to recall fondly/to think of the past
to visit a place for the memories/to pay homage to (the deceased)
to recall fondly/to remember with emotion
grief-stricken thoughts/mourning
to mourn/to pay last respects/mourning/memorial (service etc)
to grieve/to mourn/deep sorrow/grief
mourn/grieve over sb's death
to recall with emotion/to feel sentiments
to grieve for deceased relative/to mourn
to pay careful attention to one's parents' funerary rites
to offer sacrifices (to one's ancestors)/to hold or attend a memorial service
to die/death
to commemorate/to remember/CL:個|个[ge4]
to eulogize/to praise
